label: 礼
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: (Jap. rei, rai) a Chinese ideology of ideal social order, hierarchy, and harmony to be maintained in government and broader society by ceremony, protocol, procedure, and law. As an ideal of Chinese society and government, it was imported to Japan through classical texts and Chinese-style monarchical and legal sysems.
